title: 【やさしい日本語】ウクライナから 来(き)た 17歳(さい)の 男性(だんせい)が、たくさん 勉強(べんきょう)して 日本(にっぽん)の 高校(こうこう)に 入(はい)る
cleaned_sentences: Samarha, who wrote "Heiwa" It has been almost a year since Russia began attacking Ukraine last February.
17-year-old Alexander Samarha fled from Ukraine to Sasebo in June.
At first, I was worried because I didn't understand Japanese, but I did my best at studying at Japanese language school and at home.
I passed the "N 4" in the Japanese Language Proficiency Test in December.
On February 17th of this year, a Speech Contest was held at the Japanese Language School.
Samarha spoke about the incident since the Russian attack began.
In April, Samarha will be enrolled at a high school in Sasebo City.
I want to convey the importance of peace to the friends I meet in high school.
